metadata.title: CVE-2021-26676 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
gdhcp in ConnMan before 1.39 could be used by network-adjacent attackers toleak sensitive stack information, allowing further exploitation of bugs ingdhcp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
connman-vpn - 1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: connman package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.21-1.2+deb8u1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
